subject: p12124741
History: Colon cancer, status post subclavian Port-A-Cath placement. Evaluate for pneumothorax.
Findings: The new right Port-A-Cath is seen with the tip terminating in the low SVC. There is no pneumothorax, mediastinal widening or other evidence of procedural complication. The lungs are otherwise clear. Heart size is top normal. There is a probable small left layering pleural effusion. There is slight rightward deviation of the superior trachea which may be the result of mass effect from a goiter.
Impression: New Port-A-Cath terminating in the low SVC with no pneumothorax or other evidence of procedural complication. Possible small left pleural effusion. Possible mass effect on the trachea from a goiter. Correlation with physical exam and/or non-emergent thyroid ultrasound is recommended.
